intro: Thecostele maingayi, commonly known as the Malabar costleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
